FuncDef:
The ipv6 ppp assign-interfaceid command configures the device to allocate interface IDs during IPv6 CP negotiation.
The undo ipv6 ppp assign-interfaceid command restores the default configuration.
By default, the device accepts the interface IDs that are not 0 and do not conflict with one another carried in Configure-Request messages sent from users during IPv6 CP negotiation.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The ipv6 ppp assign-interfaceid command can be used to configure the device to allocate interface IDs, allowing carriers to manage interface IDs in a centralized manner.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
When a RADIUS server allocates interface IDs, users must accept the allocated interface IDs. If they do not accept the interface IDs, IPv6CP negotiation will fail.
